newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Israel begins easing closure of West Bank city.
newsitem.headline: Israel begins easing closure of West Bank city.

text.p: Israel on Tuesday began easing a closure of the PLO-ruled city of Ramallah in the West Bank imposed after a fatal attack on Jewish settlers, the army and witnesses said.
"The Israeli army began this morning gradual easing of the closure on the city of Ramallah," the army said in a statement.
Witnesses said Israel had removed a checkpoint at the southern entrance to the self-ruled enclave erected following the killing of two Jewish settlers by Arab gunmen near Ramallah on Wednesday.
The Damascus-based Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine claimed responsibility for the attack.
The army said Ramallah remained a closed military area to Israeli citizens.
Palestinians condemned the five-day closure as "collective punishment".
